text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- King Hussein meets lower house of parliament, urges dialogue, cohesion and sense of belonging to build future.
- King calls for setting up applied university in Balqa governorate, prince Ghazi named chairman of its board of trustees.
- The start of 1996 scholastic year postponed for a week.
- Prime Minister Abdul-Karim al-Kabariti promises to release detainees.
- IMF allows Jordan to withdraw $60 million in development credit.
- House speaker says deputies loyalty is for king and country. Several deputies praise meeting with king.
